text: A pegmatite is an igneous rock with a very rough texture, which has large interlocking crystals that are usually bigger than and sometimes bigger than . Many of the world's largest crystals are found in pegmatites. These include crystals of quartz, mica, beryl, and tourmaline. Some of these crystals are over long. ==Etymology== The word pegmatite comes from the Homeric Greek word, πήγνυμι (pēgnymi), which means “to bind together." This refers to the interlocked crystals in the rock's texture. ==References== Category:Igneous rocks
